00083 #ifndef M_PI
00084 #define M_PI           3.14159265358979323846  /* pi */
00085 #endif
00086 
00087 #define DEG2RAD(x) (((x) * M_PI) / 180.0)
00088 //#define EPSILON (4.37114e-07)
00089 
00090 const double epsilon = 4.37114e-05;
00091 #define EPSILON epsilon

00097 template <class T>
00098 class Vector2
00099 {
00100 public:
00101         union
00102         {
00106                 T x;
00107 
00112                 T s;
00113         };
00114 
00115         union
00116         {
00120                 T y;
00121 
00126                 T t;
00127         };
00128 
00129         //----------------[ constructors ]--------------------------
00133         Vector2() : x(0), y(0)
00134         {       }
00135 
00136 
00137 
00143         Vector2(T nx, T ny) : x(nx), y(ny)
00144         {       }
00145 
00146 
00151         Vector2(const Vector2<T>& src)
00152                         : x(src.x), y(src.y)
00153         {        }
00154 
00155 
00160         template <class FromT>
00161         Vector2(const Vector2<FromT>& src)
00162                         : x(static_cast<T>(src.x)),
00163                         y(static_cast<T>(src.y))
00164         {        }
00165 
00166 
00167         //----------------[ access operators ]-------------------
00172         template <class FromT>
00173         Vector2<T>& operator=(const Vector2<FromT>& rhs)
00174         {
00175                 x = static_cast<T>(rhs.x);
00176                 y = static_cast<T>(rhs.y);
00177                 return * this;
00178         }
00179 
00184         Vector2<T>& operator=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00185         {
00186                 x = rhs.x;
00187                 y = rhs.y;
00188                 return * this;
00189         }
00190 
00191 
00198         T& operator[](int n)
00199         {
00200                 assert(n >= 0 && n <= 1);
00201                 if (0 == n) return x;
00202                 else
00203                         return y;
00204         }
00205 
00206 
00207         //---------------[ vector aritmetic operator ]--------------
00212         Vector2<T> operator+(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00213         {
00214                 return Vector2<T> (x + rhs.x, y + rhs.y);
00215         }
00216 
00221         Vector2<T> operator-(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00222         {
00223                 return Vector2<T> (x - rhs.x, y - rhs.y);
00224         }
00225 
00230         Vector2<T> operator*(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00231         {
00232                 return Vector2<T> (x * rhs.x, y * rhs.y);
00233         }
00234 
00239         Vector2<T> operator/(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00240         {
00241                 return Vector2<T> (x / rhs.x, y / rhs.y);
00242         }
00243 
00248         Vector2<T>& operator+=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00249         {
00250                 x += rhs.x;
00251                 y += rhs.y;
00252                 return * this;
00253         }
00254 
00259         Vector2<T>& operator-=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00260         {
00261                 x -= rhs.x;
00262                 y -= rhs.y;
00263                 return * this;
00264         }
00265 
00270         Vector2<T>& operator*=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00271         {
00272                 x *= rhs.x;
00273                 y *= rhs.y;
00274                 return * this;
00275         }
00276 
00281         Vector2<T>& operator/=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00282         {
00283                 x /= rhs.x;
00284                 y /= rhs.y;
00285                 return * this;
00286         }
00287 
00288         //--------------[ scalar vector operator ]--------------------
00293         Vector2<T> operator+(T rhs) const
00294         {
00295                 return Vector2<T> (x + rhs, y + rhs);
00296         }
00297 
00302         Vector2<T> operator-(T rhs) const
00303         {
00304                 return Vector2<T> (x - rhs, y - rhs);
00305         }
00306 
00311         Vector2<T> operator*(T rhs) const
00312         {
00313                 return Vector2<T> (x * rhs, y * rhs);
00314         }
00315 
00320         Vector2<T> operator/(T rhs) const
00321         {
00322                 return Vector2<T> (x / rhs, y / rhs);
00323         }
00324 
00329         Vector2<T>& operator+=(T rhs)
00330         {
00331                 x += rhs;
00332                 y += rhs;
00333                 return * this;
00334         }
00335 
00340         Vector2<T>& operator-=(T rhs)
00341         {
00342                 x -= rhs;
00343                 y -= rhs;
00344                 return * this;
00345         }
00346 
00351         Vector2<T>& operator*=(T rhs)
00352         {
00353                 x *= rhs;
00354                 y *= rhs;
00355                 return * this;
00356         }
00357 
00362         Vector2<T>& operator/=(T rhs)
00363         {
00364                 x /= rhs;
00365                 y /= rhs;
00366                 return * this;
00367         }
00368 
00369         //--------------[ equality operator ]------------------------
00377         bool operator==(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00378         {
00379                 return (std::abs(x - rhs.x) < EPSILON) && (std::abs(y - rhs.y) < EPSILON);
00380         }
00381 
00382 
00388         bool operator!=(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00389         {
00390                 return ! (*this == rhs);
00391         }
00392 
00393         //-------------[ unary operations ]--------------------------
00398         Vector2<T> operator-() const
00399         {
00400                 return Vector2<T>(-x, -y);
00401         }
00402 
00403         //-------------[ size operations ]---------------------------
00408         T length()
00409         {
00410                 return (T)std::sqrt(x * x + y * y);
00411         }
00412 
00416         void normalize()
00417         {
00418                 T s = length();
00419                 x /= s;
00420                 y /= s;
00421         }
00422 
00430         T lengthSq()
00431         {
00432                 return x * x + y * y;
00433         }
00434 
00435         //--------------[ misc. operations ]-----------------------
00445         Vector2<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector2<T>& r) const
00446         {
00447                 return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;
00448         }
00449 
00450 
00451         //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
00457         operator T*()
00458         {
00459                 return (T*) this;
00460         }
00466         operator const T*() const
00467         {
00468                 return (const T*) this;
00469         }
00470 
00471         //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
00478         friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00479         {
00480                 lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "]";
00481                 return lhs;
00482         }
00483 
00484 
00485 };

00490 //-------------------------------------

00494 typedef class Vector2 <double> Vector2d;

00500 template <class T>
00501 class Vector3
00502 {
00503 public:
00504         //T x, y, z;
00505         union
00506         {
00510                 T x;
00511 
00516                 T s;
00517 
00522                 T r;
00523         };
00524 
00525         union
00526         {
00530                 T y;
00535                 T t;
00540                 T g;
00541         };
00542 
00543         union
00544         {
00548                 T z;
00549 
00554                 T u;
00559                 T b;
00560         };
00561 
00562         //----------------[ constructors ]--------------------------
00566         Vector3() : x(0), y(0), z(0)
00567         {       }
00568 
00575         Vector3(T nx, T ny, T nz) : x(nx), y(ny), z(nz)
00576         {       }
00577 
00582         Vector3(const Vector3<T>& src)
00583                         : x(src.x), y(src.y), z(src.z)
00584         {}
00585 
00590         template <class FromT>
00591         Vector3(const Vector3<FromT>& src)
00592                         : x(static_cast<T>(src.x)),
00593                         y(static_cast<T>(src.y)),
00594                         z(static_cast<T>(src.z))
00595         {}
00596 
00597 
00598         //----------------[ access operators ]-------------------
00603         Vector3<T> operator=(const Vector3<T>& rhs)
00604         {
00605                 x = rhs.x;
00606                 y = rhs.y;
00607                 z = rhs.z;
00608                 return * this;
00609         }
00610 
00615         template <class FromT>
00616         Vector3<T> operator=(const Vector3<FromT>& rhs)
00617         {
00618                 x = static_cast<T>(rhs.x);
00619                 y = static_cast<T>(rhs.y);
00620                 z = static_cast<T>(rhs.z);
00621                 return * this;
00622         }
00623 
00631         T & operator[](int n)
00632         {
00633                 assert(n >= 0 && n <= 2);
00634                 if (0 == n) return x;
00635                 else if (1 == n) return y;
00636                 else
00637                         return z;
00638         }
00639 
00640 
00641         //---------------[ vector aritmetic operator ]--------------
00646         Vector3<T> operator+(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00647         {
00648                 return Vector3<T> (x + rhs.x, y + rhs.y, z + rhs.z);
00649         }
00650 
00655         Vector3<T> operator-(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00656         {
00657                 return Vector3<T> (x - rhs.x, y - rhs.y, z - rhs.z);
00658         }
00659 
00664         Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00665         {
00666                 return Vector3<T> (x * rhs.x, y * rhs.y, z * rhs.z);
00667         }
00668 
00673         Vector3<T> operator/(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00674         {
00675                 return Vector3<T> (x / rhs.x, y / rhs.y, z / rhs.z);
00676         }
00677 
00682         Vector3<T>& operator+=(const Vector3<T>& rhs)
00683         {
00684                 x += rhs.x;
00685                 y += rhs.y;
00686                 z += rhs.z;
00687                 return * this;
00688         }
00689 
00694         Vector3<T>& operator-=(const Vector3<T>& rhs)
00695         {
00696                 x -= rhs.x;
00697                 y -= rhs.y;
00698                 z -= rhs.z;
00699                 return * this;
00700         }
00701 
00706         Vector3<T>& operator*=(const Vector3<T>& rhs)
00707         {
00708                 x *= rhs.x;
00709                 y *= rhs.y;
00710                 z *= rhs.z;
00711                 return * this;
00712         }
00713 
00718         Vector3<T>& operator/=(const Vector3<T>& rhs)
00719         {
00720                 x /= rhs.x;
00721                 y /= rhs.y;
00722                 z /= rhs.z;
00723                 return * this;
00724         }
00725 
00730         T dotProduct(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00731         {
00732                 return x * rhs.x + y * rhs.y + z * rhs.z;
00733         }
00734 
00739         Vector3<T> crossProduct(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00740         {
00741                 return Vector3<T> (y * rhs.z - rhs.y * z, z * rhs.x - rhs.z * x, x * rhs.y - rhs.x * y);
00742         }
00743 
00744 
00745         //--------------[ scalar vector operator ]--------------------
00750         Vector3<T> operator+(T rhs) const
00751         {
00752                 return Vector3<T> (x + rhs, y + rhs, z + rhs);
00753         }
00754 
00759         Vector3<T> operator-(T rhs) const
00760         {
00761                 return Vector3<T> (x - rhs, y - rhs, z - rhs);
00762         }
00763 
00768         Vector3<T> operator*(T rhs) const
00769         {
00770                 return Vector3<T> (x * rhs, y * rhs, z * rhs);
00771         }
00772 
00777         Vector3<T> operator/(T rhs) const
00778         {
00779                 return Vector3<T> (x / rhs, y / rhs, z / rhs);
00780         }
00781 
00786         Vector3<T>& operator+=(T rhs)
00787         {
00788                 x += rhs;
00789                 y += rhs;
00790                 z += rhs;
00791                 return * this;
00792         }
00793 
00798         Vector3<T>& operator-=(T rhs)
00799         {
00800                 x -= rhs;
00801                 y -= rhs;
00802                 z -= rhs;
00803                 return * this;
00804         }
00805 
00810         Vector3<T>& operator*=(T rhs)
00811         {
00812                 x *= rhs;
00813                 y *= rhs;
00814                 z *= rhs;
00815                 return * this;
00816         }
00817 
00822         Vector3<T>& operator/=(T rhs)
00823         {
00824                 x /= rhs;
00825                 y /= rhs;
00826                 z /= rhs;
00827                 return * this;
00828         }
00829 
00830         //--------------[ equiality operator ]------------------------
00838         bool operator==(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00839         {
00840                 return std::fabs(x - rhs.x) < EPSILON
00841                        && std::fabs(y - rhs.y) < EPSILON
00842                        && std::fabs(z - rhs.z) < EPSILON;
00843         }
00844 
00850         bool operator!=(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00851         {
00852                 return !(*this == rhs);
00853         }
00854 
00855         //-------------[ unary operations ]--------------------------
00860         Vector3<T> operator-() const
00861         {
00862                 return Vector3<T>(-x, -y, -z);
00863         }
00864 
00865         //-------------[ size operations ]---------------------------
00870         T length() const
00871         {
00872                 return (T)std::sqrt(x * x + y * y + z * z);
00873         }
00874 
00882         T lengthSq() const
00883         {
00884                 return x * x + y * y + z * z;
00885         }
00886 
00890         void normalize()
00891         {
00892                 T s = length();
00893                 x /= s;
00894                 y /= s;
00895                 z /= s;
00896         }
00897 
00898         //------------[ other operations ]---------------------------
00905         void rotate(T ax, T ay, T az)
00906         {
00907                 T a = cos(DEG2RAD(ax));
00908                 T b = sin(DEG2RAD(ax));
00909                 T c = cos(DEG2RAD(ay));
00910                 T d = sin(DEG2RAD(ay));
00911                 T e = cos(DEG2RAD(az));
00912                 T f = sin(DEG2RAD(az));
00913                 T nx = c * e * x - c * f * y + d * z;
00914                 T ny = (a * f + b * d * e) * x + (a * e - b * d * f) * y - b * c * z;
00915                 T nz = (b * f - a * d * e) * x + (a * d * f + b * e) * y + a * c * z;
00916                 x = nx;
00917                 y = ny;
00918                 z = nz;
00919 
00920 
00921         }
00922 
00932         Vector3<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector3<T>& r) const
00933         {
00934                 return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;
00935         }
00936 
00937 
00938 
00939 
00940 
00941         //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
00942 
00948         operator T*()
00949         {
00950                 return (T*) this;
00951         }
00952 
00958         operator const T*() const
00959         {
00960                 return (const T*) this;
00961         }
00962 
00963         //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
00970         friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector3<T> rhs)
00971         {
00972                 lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "," << rhs.z  << "]";
00973                 return lhs;
00974         }
00975 
00976 };
00977

00987 template <class T>
00988 class Vector4
00989 {
00990 public:
00991 
00992         union
00993         {
00998                 T r;
01002                 T x;
01003         };
01004 
01005         union
01006         {
01011                 T g;
01015                 T y;
01016         };
01017 
01018         union
01019         {
01024                 T b;
01028                 T z;
01029         };
01030 
01031         union
01032         {
01037                 T a;
01043                 T w;
01044         };
01045 
01046         //----------------[ constructors ]--------------------------
01050         Vector4() : x(0), y(0), z(0), w(0)
01051         { }
01052 
01053 
01061         Vector4(T nx, T ny, T nz, T nw) : x(nx), y(ny), z(nz), w(nw)
01062         { }
01063 
01068         Vector4(const Vector4<T>& src)
01069                         : x(src.x), y(src.y), z(src.z), w(src.w)
01070         {}
01071 
01076         template <class FromT>
01077         Vector4(const Vector4<FromT>& src)
01078                         : x(static_cast<T>(src.x)),
01079                         y(static_cast<T>(src.y)),
01080                         z(static_cast<T>(src.z)),
01081                         w(static_cast<T>(src.w))
01082         {}
01083 
01084 
01085         //----------------[ access operators ]-------------------
01090         Vector4<T> operator=(const Vector4<T>& rhs)
01091         {
01092                 x = rhs.x;
01093                 y = rhs.y;
01094                 z = rhs.z;
01095                 w = rhs.w;
01096                 return * this;
01097         }
01098 
01103         template<class FromT>
01104         Vector4<T> operator=(const Vector4<FromT>& rhs)
01105         {
01106                 x = static_cast<T>(rhs.x);
01107                 y = static_cast<T>(rhs.y);
01108                 z = static_cast<T>(rhs.z);
01109                 w = static_cast<T>(rhs.w);
01110                 return * this;
01111         }
01112 
01113 
01121         T & operator[](int n)
01122         {
01123                 assert(n >= 0 && n <= 3);
01124                 if (0 == n) return x;
01125                 else if (1 == n) return y;
01126                 else if (2 == n) return z;
01127                 else return w;
01128         }
01129 
01130 
01131         //---------------[ vector aritmetic operator ]--------------
01136         Vector4<T> operator+(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const
01137         {
01138                 return Vector4<T> (x + rhs.x, y + rhs.y, z + rhs.z, w + rhs.w);
01139         }
01140 
01145         Vector4<T> operator-(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const
01146         {
01147                 return Vector4<T> (x - rhs.x, y - rhs.y, z - rhs.z, w - rhs.w);
01148         }
01149 
01154         Vector4<T> operator*(const Vector4<T> rhs) const
01155         {
01156                 return Vector4<T> (x * rhs.x, y * rhs.y, z * rhs.z, w * rhs.w);
01157         }
01158 
01163         Vector4<T> operator/(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const
01164         {
01165                 return Vector4<T> (x / rhs.x, y / rhs.y, z / rhs.z, w / rhs.w);
01166         }
01167 
01172         Vector4<T>& operator+=(const Vector4<T>& rhs)
01173         {
01174                 x += rhs.x;
01175                 y += rhs.y;
01176                 z += rhs.z;
01177                 w += rhs.w;
01178                 return * this;
01179         }
01180 
01185         Vector4<T>& operator-=(const Vector4<T>& rhs)
01186         {
01187                 x -= rhs.x;
01188                 y -= rhs.y;
01189                 z -= rhs.z;
01190                 w -= rhs.w;
01191                 return * this;
01192         }
01193 
01198         Vector4<T>& operator*=(const Vector4<T>& rhs)
01199         {
01200                 x *= rhs.x;
01201                 y *= rhs.y;
01202                 z *= rhs.z;
01203                 w *= rhs.w;
01204                 return * this;
01205         }
01206 
01211         Vector4<T>& operator/=(const Vector4<T>& rhs)
01212         {
01213                 x /= rhs.x;
01214                 y /= rhs.y;
01215                 z /= rhs.z;
01216                 w /= rhs.w;
01217                 return * this;
01218         }
01219 
01220         //--------------[ equiality operator ]------------------------
01228         bool operator==(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const
01229         {
01230                 return std::fabs(x - rhs.x) < EPSILON
01231                        && std::fabs(y - rhs.y) < EPSILON
01232                        && std::fabs(z - rhs.z) < EPSILON
01233                        && std::fabs(w - rhs.w) < EPSILON;
01234         }
01235 
01236 
01242         bool operator!=(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const
01243         {
01244                 return ! (*this == rhs);
01245         }
01246 
01247         //-------------[ unary operations ]--------------------------
01252         Vector4<T> operator-() const
01253         {
01254                 return Vector4<T>(-x, -y, -z, -w);
01255         }
01256 
01257         //--------------[ scalar vector operator ]--------------------
01258 
01263         Vector4<T> operator+(T rhs) const
01264         {
01265                 return Vector4<T> (x + rhs, y + rhs, z + rhs, w + rhs);
01266         }
01267 
01272         Vector4<T> operator-(T rhs) const
01273         {
01274                 return Vector4<T> (x - rhs, y - rhs, z - rhs, w - rhs);
01275         }
01276 
01281         Vector4<T> operator*(T rhs) const
01282         {
01283                 return Vector4<T> (x * rhs, y * rhs, z * rhs, w * rhs);
01284         }
01285 
01290         Vector4<T> operator/(T rhs) const
01291         {
01292                 return Vector4<T> (x / rhs, y / rhs, z / rhs, w / rhs);
01293         }
01294 
01299         Vector4<T>& operator+=(T rhs)
01300         {
01301                 x += rhs;
01302                 y += rhs;
01303                 z += rhs;
01304                 w += rhs;
01305                 return * this;
01306         }
01307 
01312         Vector4<T>& operator-=(T rhs)
01313         {
01314                 x -= rhs;
01315                 y -= rhs;
01316                 z -= rhs;
01317                 w -= rhs;
01318                 return * this;
01319         }
01320 
01325         Vector4<T>& operator*=(T rhs)
01326         {
01327                 x *= rhs;
01328                 y *= rhs;
01329                 z *= rhs;
01330                 w *= rhs;
01331                 return * this;
01332         }
01333 
01338         Vector4<T>& operator/=(T rhs)
01339         {
01340                 x /= rhs;
01341                 y /= rhs;
01342                 z /= rhs;
01343                 w /= rhs;
01344                 return * this;
01345         }
01346 
01347         //-------------[ size operations ]---------------------------
01352         T length() const
01353         {
01354                 return (T)std::sqrt(x * x + y * y + z * z + w * w);
01355         }
01356 
01360         void normalize()
01361         {
01362                 T s = length();
01363                 x /= s;
01364                 y /= s;
01365                 z /= s;
01366                 w /= s;
01367         }
01368 
01376         T lengthSq() const
01377         {
01378                 return x * x + y * y + z * z + w * w;
01379         }
01380 
01381         //--------------[ misc. operations ]-----------------------
01391         Vector4<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector4<T>& r) const
01392         {
01393                 return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;
01394         }
01395 
01396 
01397 
01398 
01399         //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
01400 
01406         operator T*()
01407         {
01408                 return (T*) this;
01409         }
01410 
01411 
01417         operator const T*() const
01418         {
01419                 return (const T*) this;
01420         }
01421 
01422         //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
01429         friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector4<T>& rhs)
01430         {
01431                 lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "," << rhs.z << "," << rhs.w << "]";
01432                 return lhs;
01433         }
01434 };
01435

01439 typedef Vector4<double> Vector4d;

01444 
01449 template <class T>
01450 class Matrix3
01451 {
01452 public:
01454         T data[9];
01455 
01456         //--------------------------[ constructors ]-------------------------------
01460         Matrix3()
01461         {
01462                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01463                         data[i] = (i % 4) ? 0 : 1;
01464         }
01465 
01470         Matrix3(const T * dt)
01471         {
01472                 std::memcpy(data, dt, sizeof(T) * 9);
01473         }
01474 
01479         Matrix3(const Matrix3<T>& src)
01480         {
01481                 std::memcpy(data, src.data, sizeof(T) * 9);
01482         }
01483 
01488         template<class FromT>
01489         Matrix3(const Matrix3<FromT>& src)
01490         {
01491                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01492                 {
01493                         data[i] = static_cast<T>(src.data[i]);
01494                 }
01495         }
01496 
01500         void identity()
01501         {
01502                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01503                         data[i] = (i % 4) ? 0 : 1;
01504         }
01505 
01506 
01507 
01514         static Matrix3<T> createRotationAroundAxis(T a, T b, T c)
01515         {
01516                 Matrix3<T> ma, mb, mc;
01517                 float ac = cos(a);
01518                 float as = sin(a);
01519                 float bc = cos(b);
01520                 float bs = sin(b);
01521                 float cc = cos(c);
01522                 float cs = sin(c);
01523 
01524                 ma.at(1, 1) = ac;
01525                 ma.at(2, 1) = as;
01526                 ma.at(1, 2) = -as;
01527                 ma.at(2, 2) = ac;
01528 
01529                 mb.at(0, 0) = bc;
01530                 mb.at(2, 0) = -bs;
01531                 mb.at(0, 2) = bs;
01532                 mb.at(2, 2) = bc;
01533 
01534                 mc.at(0, 0) = cc;
01535                 mc.at(1, 0) = cs;
01536                 mc.at(0, 1) = -cs;
01537                 mc.at(1, 1) = cc;
01538 
01539                 Matrix3<T> ret = ma * mb * mc;
01540                 return ret;
01541         }
01542 
01546         template <class It>
01547         static Matrix3<T> fromOde(const It* mat)
01548         {
01549                 Matrix3<T> ret;
01550                 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01551                 {
01552                         for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01553                         {
01554                                 ret.at(i, j) = static_cast<T>(mat[j * 4 + i]);
01555                         }
01556                 }
01557                 return ret;
01558         }
01559 
01560 
01561         //---------------------[ equiality operators ]------------------------------
01570         bool operator==(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01571         {
01572                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01573                 {
01574                         if (std::fabs(data[i] - rhs.data[i]) >= EPSILON)
01575                                 return false;
01576                 }
01577                 return true;
01578         }
01579 
01580 
01586         bool operator!=(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01587         {
01588                 return !(*this == rhs);
01589         }
01590 
01591 
01592         //---------------------[ access operators ]---------------------------------
01598         T& at(int x, int y)
01599         {
01600                 assert(x >= 0 && x < 3);
01601                 assert(y >= 0 && y < 3);
01602                 return data[x * 3 + y];
01603         }
01604 
01610         const T& at(int x, int y) const
01611         {
01612                 assert(x >= 0 && x < 3);
01613                 assert(y >= 0 && y < 3);
01614                 return data[x * 3 + y];
01615         }
01616 
01621         Matrix3<T>& operator=(const Matrix3<T>& rhs)
01622         {
01623                 std::memcpy(data, rhs.data, sizeof(T) * 9);
01624                 return * this;
01625         }
01626 
01631         template<class FromT>
01632         Matrix3<T>& operator=(const Matrix3<FromT>& rhs)
01633         {
01634                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01635                 {
01636                         data[i] = static_cast<T>(rhs.data[i]);
01637                 }
01638                 return * this;
01639         }
01640 
01645         Matrix3<T>& operator=(const T* rhs)
01646         {
01647                 std::memcpy(data, rhs, sizeof(T) * 9);
01648                 return * this;
01649         }
01650 
01651 
01652         /*Matrix3<T> & operator=(const double* m)
01653           {
01654           for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) data[i] = (T)m[i];
01655           return * this;
01656           }*/
01657 
01658         //--------------------[ matrix with matrix operations ]---------------------
01663         Matrix3<T> operator+(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01664         {
01665                 Matrix3<T> ret;
01666                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01667                         ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs.data[i];
01668                 return ret;
01669         }
01670 
01675         Matrix3<T> operator-(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01676         {
01677                 Matrix3<T> ret;
01678                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01679                         ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs.data[i];
01680                 return ret;
01681         }
01682 
01683         //--------------------[ matrix with scalar operations ]---------------------
01688         Matrix3<T> operator+(T rhs) const
01689         {
01690                 Matrix3<T> ret;
01691                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01692                         ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs;
01693                 return ret;
01694         }
01695 
01700         Matrix3<T> operator-(T rhs) const
01701         {
01702                 Matrix3<T> ret;
01703                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01704                         ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs;
01705                 return ret;
01706         }
01707 
01712         Matrix3<T> operator*(T rhs) const
01713         {
01714                 Matrix3<T> ret;
01715                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01716                         ret.data[i] = data[i] * rhs;
01717                 return ret;
01718         }
01719 
01724         Matrix3<T> operator/(T rhs) const
01725         {
01726                 Matrix3<T> ret;
01727                 for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01728                         ret.data[i] = data[i] / rhs;
01729                 return ret;
01730         }
01731 
01732 
01733         //--------------------[ multiply operators ]--------------------------------
01738         Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
01739         {
01740                 return Vector3<T>(
01741                            data[0] * rhs.x + data[3] * rhs.y + data[6] * rhs.z,
01742                            data[1] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[7] * rhs.z,
01743                            data[2] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[8] * rhs.z
01744                        );
01745         }
01746 
01751         Matrix3<T> operator*(Matrix3<T> rhs) const
01752         {
01753                 static Matrix3<T> w;
01754                 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01755                 {
01756                         for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01757                         {
01758                                 T n = 0;
01759                                 for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) n += rhs.at(i, k) * at(k, j);
01760                                 w.at(i, j) = n;
01761                         }
01762                 }
01763                 return w;
01764 
01765         }
01766 
01767 
01768         //---------------------------[ misc operations ]----------------------------
01772         Matrix3<T> transpose()
01773         {
01774                 Matrix3<T> ret;
01775                 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01776                 {
01777                         for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01778                         {
01779                                 ret.at(i, j) = at(j, i);
01780                         }
01781                 }
01782                 return ret;
01783         }
01784 
01794         Matrix3<T> lerp(T fact, const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01795         {
01796                 Matrix3<T> ret = (*this) + (rhs - (*this)) * fact;
01797                 return ret;
01798         }
01799 
01800 
01801         //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
01802 
01808         operator T*()
01809         {
01810                 return (T*) data;
01811         }
01812 
01818         operator const T*() const
01819         {
01820                 return (const T*) data;
01821         }
01822 
01823         //----------[ output operator ]----------------------------
01830         friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& lhs, const Matrix3<T>& rhs)
01831         {
01832                 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01833                 {
01834                         lhs << "|\t";
01835                         for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01836                         {
01837                                 lhs << rhs.at(j, i) << "\t";
01838                         }
01839                         lhs << "|" << std::endl;
01840                 }
01841                 return lhs;
01842         }
01843 
01844 };

01856 template <class T>
01857 class Matrix4
01858 {
01859 public:
01861         T data[16];
01862 
01863         //--------------------------[ constructors ]-------------------------------
01867         Matrix4()
01868         {
01869                 for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01870                         data[i] = (i % 5) ? 0 : 1;
01871         }
01872 
01877         Matrix4(const T * dt)
01878         {
01879                 std::memcpy(data, dt, sizeof(T) * 16);
01880         }
01881 
01886         Matrix4(const Matrix4<T>& src)
01887         {
01888                 std::memcpy(data, src.data, sizeof(T) * 16);
01889         }
01890 
01895         template <class FromT>
01896         Matrix4(const Matrix4<FromT>& src)
01897         {
01898                 for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01899                 {
01900                         data[i] = static_cast<T>(src.data[i]);
01901                 }
01902         }
01903 
01907         void identity()
01908         {
01909                 for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01910                         data[i] = (i % 5) ? 0 : 1;
01911         }
01912 
01913 
01914 
01921         static Matrix4<T> createRotationAroundAxis(T a, T b, T c)
01922         {
01923                 Matrix4<T> ma, mb, mc;
01924                 float ac = cos(a);
01925                 float as = sin(a);
01926                 float bc = cos(b);
01927                 float bs = sin(b);
01928                 float cc = cos(c);
01929                 float cs = sin(c);
01930 
01931                 ma.at(1, 1) = ac;
01932                 ma.at(2, 1) = as;
01933                 ma.at(1, 2) = -as;
01934                 ma.at(2, 2) = ac;
01935 
01936                 mb.at(0, 0) = bc;
01937                 mb.at(2, 0) = -bs;
01938                 mb.at(0, 2) = bs;
01939                 mb.at(2, 2) = bc;
01940 
01941                 mc.at(0, 0) = cc;
01942                 mc.at(1, 0) = cs;
01943                 mc.at(0, 1) = -cs;
01944                 mc.at(1, 1) = cc;
01945 
01946                 /*std::cout << "RotVec = " << a << "," << b << "," << c << std::endl;
01947                   std::cout << "Rx = " << std::endl << ma;
01948                   std::cout << "Ry = " << std::endl << mb;
01949                   std::cout << "Rz = " << std::endl << mc;*/
01950 
01951                 Matrix4<T> ret = ma * mb * mc;
01952                 //std::cout << "Result = " << std::endl << ma * (mb * mc);
01953 
01954                 return ret;
01955         }
01956 
01958 
01965         static Matrix4<T> createTranslation(T x, T y, T z, T w = 1)
01966         {
01967                 Matrix4 ret;
01968                 ret.at(3, 0) = x;
01969                 ret.at(3, 1) = y;
01970                 ret.at(3, 2) = z;
01971                 ret.at(3, 3) = w;
01972 
01973                 return ret;
01974         }
01975 
01976 
01977         //---------------------[ equiality operators ]------------------------------
01986         bool operator==(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
01987         {
01988                 for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01989                 {
01990                         if (std::fabs(data[i] - rhs.data[i]) >= EPSILON)
01991                                 return false;
01992                 }
01993                 return true;
01994         }

02001         bool operator!=(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02002         {

02004         }

02019 
02025         const T& at(int x, int y) const
02026         {

02028                 assert(y >= 0 && y < 4);

02183         //--------------------[ multiply operators ]--------------------------------
02188         Vector4<T> operator*(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const
02189         {
02190                 return Vector4<T>(
02191                            data[0] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[8]  * rhs.z + data[12] * rhs.w,
02192                            data[1] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[9]  * rhs.z + data[13] * rhs.w,
02193                            data[2] * rhs.x + data[6] * rhs.y + data[10] * rhs.z + data[14] * rhs.w,
02194                            data[3] * rhs.x + data[7] * rhs.y + data[11] * rhs.z + data[15] * rhs.w
02195                        );
02196 
02197         }
02198 
02204         //Original
02205         /*Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
02206         {
02207                 return Vector3<T>(
02208                            data[0] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[8] * rhs.z,
02209                            data[1] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[9] * rhs.z,
02210                            data[2] * rhs.x + data[6] * rhs.y + data[10] * rhs.z
02211                        );
02212         }*/
02213 
02214         //Angepasst fr Translation
02215         Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
02216         {
02217                 return Vector3<T>(
02218                            data[0] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[8]  * rhs.z + data[12] * 1,
02219                            data[1] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[9]  * rhs.z + data[13] * 1,
02220                            data[2] * rhs.x + data[6] * rhs.y + data[10] * rhs.z + data[14] * 1
02221                        );
02222 
02223         }
02224 
02229         Matrix4<T> operator*(Matrix4<T> rhs) const
02230         {
02231                 static Matrix4<T> w;
02232                 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02233                 {
02234                         for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
02235                         {
02236                                 T n = 0;
02237                                 for (int k = 0; k < 4; k++) n += rhs.at(i, k) * at(k, j);
02238                                 w.at(i, j) = n;
02239                         }
02240                 }
02241                 return w;
02242 
02243         }
02244 
02245 
02246         //---------------------------[ misc operations ]----------------------------
02247 
02253         T det()
02254         {
02255 
02256                 return
02257                     + at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3)
02258                     - at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3)
02259                     - at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3)
02260                     + at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3)
02261 
02262                     + at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3)
02263                     - at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3)
02264                     - at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02265                     + at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02266 
02267                     + at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3)
02268                     - at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3)
02269                     - at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3)
02270                     + at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3)
02271 
02272                     + at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02273                     - at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02274                     - at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3)
02275                     + at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3)
02276 
02277                     + at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3)
02278                     - at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3)
02279                     - at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3)
02280                     + at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3)
02281 
02282                     + at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3)
02283                     - at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3)
02284                     - at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3)
02285                     + at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02286 
02287 
02288         }
02289 
02290 
02297         Matrix4<T> inverse()
02298         {
02299                 Matrix4<T> ret;
02300 
02301                 ret.at(0, 0) =
02302                     + at(2, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3)
02303                     - at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3)
02304                     + at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3)
02305                     - at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3)
02306                     - at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3)
02307                     + at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02308 
02309                 ret.at(1, 0) =
02310                     + at(3, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3)
02311                     - at(2, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3)
02312                     - at(3, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3)
02313                     + at(1, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3)
02314                     + at(2, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3)
02315                     - at(1, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02316 
02317                 ret.at(2, 0) =
02318                     + at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 3)
02319                     - at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 3)
02320                     + at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 3)
02321                     - at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 3)
02322                     - at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 3)
02323                     + at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 3);
02324 
02325                 ret.at(3, 0) =
02326                     + at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 2)
02327                     - at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 2)
02328                     - at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2)
02329                     + at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 2)
02330                     + at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 2)
02331                     - at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 2);
02332 
02333                 ret.at(0, 1) =
02334                     + at(3, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3)
02335                     - at(2, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3)
02336                     - at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02337                     + at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3)
02338                     + at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3)
02339                     - at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02340 
02341                 ret.at(1, 1) =
02342                     + at(2, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3)
02343                     - at(3, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3)
02344                     + at(3, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02345                     - at(0, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(2, 3)
02346                     - at(2, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3)
02347                     + at(0, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(3, 3);
02348 
02349                 ret.at(2, 1) =
02350                     + at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 3)
02351                     - at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 3)
02352                     - at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 3)
02353                     + at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 3)
02354                     + at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 3)
02355                     - at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 3);
02356 
02357                 ret.at(3, 1) =
02358                     + at(2, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 2)
02359                     - at(3, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 2)
02360                     + at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 2)
02361                     - at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(2, 2)
02362                     - at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 2)
02363                     + at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(3, 2);
02364 
02365                 ret.at(0, 2) =
02366                     + at(1, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3)
02367                     - at(3, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3)
02368                     + at(3, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02369                     - at(0, 1) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3)
02370                     - at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3)
02371                     + at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3);
02372 
02373                 ret.at(1, 2) =
02374                     + at(3, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3)
02375                     - at(1, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(0, 3)
02376                     - at(3, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02377                     + at(0, 0) * at(3, 2) * at(1, 3)
02378                     + at(1, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(3, 3)
02379                     - at(0, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(3, 3);
02380 
02381                 ret.at(2, 2) =
02382                     + at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 3)
02383                     - at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 3)
02384                     + at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 3)
02385                     - at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 3)
02386                     - at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 3)
02387                     + at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 3);
02388 
02389                 ret.at(3, 2) =
02390                     + at(3, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 2)
02391                     - at(1, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(0, 2)
02392                     - at(3, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 2)
02393                     + at(0, 0) * at(3, 1) * at(1, 2)
02394                     + at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(3, 2)
02395                     - at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(3, 2);
02396 
02397                 ret.at(0, 3) =
02398                     + at(2, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3)
02399                     - at(1, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3)
02400                     - at(2, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02401                     + at(0, 1) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3)
02402                     + at(1, 1) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02403                     - at(0, 1) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3);
02404 
02405                 ret.at(1, 3) =
02406                     + at(1, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(0, 3)
02407                     - at(2, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(0, 3)
02408                     + at(2, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(1, 3)
02409                     - at(0, 0) * at(2, 2) * at(1, 3)
02410                     - at(1, 0) * at(0, 2) * at(2, 3)
02411                     + at(0, 0) * at(1, 2) * at(2, 3);
02412 
02413                 ret.at(2, 3) =
02414                     + at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 3)
02415                     - at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 3)
02416                     - at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 3)
02417                     + at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 3)
02418                     + at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 3)
02419                     - at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 3);
02420 
02421                 ret.at(3, 3) =
02422                     + at(1, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(0, 2)
02423                     - at(2, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(0, 2)
02424                     + at(2, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(1, 2)
02425                     - at(0, 0) * at(2, 1) * at(1, 2)
02426                     - at(1, 0) * at(0, 1) * at(2, 2)
02427                     + at(0, 0) * at(1, 1) * at(2, 2);
02428 
02429                 return ret * det();
02430         }
02431 
02432 
02433 
02437         Matrix4<T> transpose()
02438         {
02439                 Matrix4<T> ret;
02440                 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02441                 {
02442                         for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
02443                         {
02444                                 ret.at(i, j) = at(j, i);
02445                         }
02446                 }
02447                 return ret;
02448         }
02449 
02459         Matrix4<T> lerp(T fact, const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02460         {
02461                 Matrix4<T> ret = (*this) + (rhs - (*this)) * fact;
02462                 return ret;
02463         }
02464 
02465 
02466         //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
02472         operator T*()
02473         {
02474                 return (T*) data;
02475         }
02476 
02482         operator const T*() const
02483         {
02484                 return (const T*) data;
02485         }
02486 
02487         //----------[ output operator ]----------------------------
02494         friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& lhs, const Matrix4<T>& rhs)
02495         {
02496                 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02497                 {
02498                         lhs << "|\t";
02499                         for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
02500                         {
02501                                 lhs << rhs.at(j, i) << "\t";
02502                         }
02503                         lhs << "|" << std::endl;
02504                 }
02505                 return lhs;
02506         }
02507 
02508 };
02509 
02510 
02512 typedef Matrix4<float> Matrix4f;
02514 typedef Matrix4<double> Matrix4d;
02515 
02516 
02524 template <class T>
02525 class Quaternion
02526 {
02527 public:
02531         T w;
02535         Vector3<T> v;
02536 
02540         Quaternion(): w(0), v(0, 0, 0) {}
02541 
02545         Quaternion(const Quaternion<T>& q): w(q.w), v(q.v) {    }
02546 
02550         template <class FromT>
02551         Quaternion(const Quaternion<FromT>& q)
02552                         : w(static_cast<T>(q.w)),
02553                         v(q.v) {        }
02554 
02555 
02561         Quaternion(T w_, const Vector3<T>& v_): w(w_), v(v_) {}
02562 
02570         Quaternion(T w_, T x, T y, T z): w(w_), v(x, y, z) {}
02571 
02576         Quaternion<T>& operator= (const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02577         {
02578                 v = rhs.v;
02579                 w = rhs.w;
02580                 return *this;
02581         }
02582 
02587         template<class FromT>
02588         Quaternion<T>& operator= (const Quaternion<FromT>& rhs)
02589         {
02590                 v = rhs.v;
02591                 w = static_cast<T>(rhs.w);
02592                 return *this;
02593         }
02594 
02599         Quaternion<T> operator+ (const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02600         {
02601                 const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02602                 return Quaternion<T>(lhs.w + rhs.w, lhs.v + rhs.v);
02603         }
02604 
02609         Quaternion<T> operator* (const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02610         {
02611                 const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02612                 return Quaternion<T>(
02613                            lhs.w * rhs.w        - lhs.v.x * rhs.v.x     - lhs.v.y * rhs.v.y     - lhs.v.z * rhs.v.z,
02614                            lhs.w * rhs.v.x      + lhs.v.x * rhs.w       + lhs.v.y * rhs.v.z     - lhs.v.z * rhs.v.y,
02615                            lhs.w * rhs.v.y      - lhs.v.x * rhs.v.z     + lhs.v.y * rhs.w       + lhs.v.z * rhs.v.x,
02616                            lhs.w * rhs.v.z      + lhs.v.x * rhs.v.y     - lhs.v.y * rhs.v.x     + lhs.v.z * rhs.w
02617                        );
02618         }
02619 
02624         Quaternion<T> operator* (T rhs) const
02625         {
02626                 return Quaternion<T>(w*rhs, v*rhs);
02627         }
02628 
02633         Quaternion<T> operator- (const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02634         {
02635                 const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02636                 return Quaternion<T>(lhs.w - rhs.w, lhs.v - rhs.v);
02637         }
02638 
02643         Quaternion<T>& operator+= (const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02644         {
02645                 w += rhs.w;
02646                 v += rhs.v;
02647                 return *this;
02648         }
02649 
02654         Quaternion<T>& operator-= (const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02655         {
02656                 w -= rhs.w;
02657                 v -= rhs.v;
02658                 return *this;
02659         }
02660 
02665         Quaternion<T>& operator*= (const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02666         {
02667                 Quaternion q = (*this) * rhs;
02668                 v = q.v;
02669                 w = q.w;
02670                 return *this;
02671         }
02672 
02677         Quaternion<T>& operator*= (T rhs)
02678         {
02679                 w *= rhs;
02680                 v *= rhs;
02681                 return *this;
02682         }
02683 
02691         bool operator==(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02692         {
02693                 const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02694                 return (std::fabs(lhs.w - rhs.w) < EPSILON) && lhs.v == rhs.v;
02695         }
02696 
02702         bool operator!=(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02703         {
02704                 return ! (*this == rhs);
02705         }
02706 
02707         //-------------[ unary operations ]--------------------------
02712         Quaternion<T> operator-() const
02713         {
02714                 return Quaternion<T>(-w, -v);
02715         }
02716 
02721         Quaternion<T> operator~() const
02722         {
02723                 return Quaternion<T>(w, -v);
02724         }
02725 
02730         T length()
02731         {
02732                 return (T)std::sqrt(w*w + v.lengthSq());
02733         }
02734 
02742         T lengthSq()
02743         {
02744                 return w * w + v.lengthSq();
02745         }
02746 
02747 
02751         void normalize()
02752         {
02753                 T len = length();
02754                 w /= len;
02755                 v /= len;
02756         }
02757 
02765         static Quaternion<T> fromEulerAngles(T x, T y, T z)
02766         {
02767                 Quaternion<T> ret = fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(1, 0, 0), x)
02768                                     * fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(0, 1, 0), y) * fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(0, 0, 1), z);
02769                 return ret;
02770         }
02771 
02777         static Quaternion<T> fromAxisRot(Vector3<T> axis, float angleDeg)
02778         {
02779                 double angleRad = DEG2RAD(angleDeg);
02780                 double sa2 = std::sin(angleRad / 2);
02781                 double ca2 = std::cos(angleRad / 2);
02782                 return Quaternion<T>( ca2, axis * sa2);
02783         }
02784 
02789         Matrix3<T> rotMatrix()
02790         {
02791                 Matrix3<T> ret;
02792 
02793                 /*ret.at(0,0) = 1 - 2*v.y*v.y - 2*v.z*v.z;
02794                   ret.at(1,0) = 2*v.x*v.y - 2*w*v.z;
02795                   ret.at(2,0) = 2*v.x*v.z - 2*w*v.y;
02796 
02797                   ret.at(0,1) = 2*v.x*v.y + 2*w*v.z;
02798                   ret.at(1,1) = 1 - 2*v.x*v.x - 2*v.z*v.z;
02799                   ret.at(2,1) = 2*v.y*v.z - 2*w*v.x;
02800 
02801                   ret.at(0,2) = 2*v.x*v.z - 2*w*v.y;
02802                   ret.at(1,2) = 2*v.y*v.z + 2*w*v.x;
02803                   ret.at(2,2) = 1 - 2*v.x*v.x - 2*v.y*v.y;*/
02804 
02805                 T xx = v.x * v.x;
02806                 T xy = v.x * v.y;
02807                 T xz = v.x * v.z;
02808                 T xw = v.x * w;
02809 
02810                 T yy = v.y * v.y;
02811                 T yz = v.y * v.z;
02812                 T yw = v.y * w;
02813 
02814                 T zz = v.z * v.z;
02815                 T zw = v.z * w;
02816 
02817                 ret.at(0, 0) = 1 - 2 * (yy + zz);
02818                 ret.at(1, 0) = 2 * (xy - zw);
02819                 ret.at(2, 0) = 2 * (xz + yw);
02820 
02821                 ret.at(0, 1) = 2 * (xy + zw);
02822                 ret.at(1, 1) = 1 - 2 * (xx + zz);
02823                 ret.at(2, 1) = 2 * (yz - xw);
02824 
02825                 ret.at(0, 2) = 2 * (xz - yw);
02826                 ret.at(1, 2) = 2 * (yz + xw);
02827                 ret.at(2, 2) = 1 - 2 * (xx + yy);
02828 
02829 
02830                 return ret;
02831         }
02832 
02839         Matrix4<T> transform()
02840         {
02841                 Matrix4<T> ret;
02842 
02843                 T xx = v.x * v.x;
02844                 T xy = v.x * v.y;
02845                 T xz = v.x * v.z;
02846                 T xw = v.x * w;
02847 
02848                 T yy = v.y * v.y;
02849                 T yz = v.y * v.z;
02850                 T yw = v.y * w;
02851 
02852                 T zz = v.z * v.z;
02853                 T zw = v.z * w;
02854 
02855                 ret.at(0, 0) = 1 - 2 * (yy + zz);
02856                 ret.at(1, 0) = 2 * (xy - zw);
02857                 ret.at(2, 0) = 2 * (xz + yw);
02858                 ret.at(3, 0) = 0;
02859 
02860                 ret.at(0, 1) = 2 * (xy + zw);
02861                 ret.at(1, 1) = 1 - 2 * (xx + zz);
02862                 ret.at(2, 1) = 2 * (yz - xw);
02863                 ret.at(3, 1) = 0;
02864 
02865                 ret.at(0, 2) = 2 * (xz - yw);
02866                 ret.at(1, 2) = 2 * (yz + xw);
02867                 ret.at(2, 2) = 1 - 2 * (xx + yy);
02868                 ret.at(3, 2) = 0;
02869 
02870                 ret.at(0, 3) = 0;
02871                 ret.at(1, 3) = 0;
02872                 ret.at(2, 3) = 0;
02873                 ret.at(3, 3) = 1;
02874 
02875                 return ret;
02876 
02877         }
02878 
02888         Quaternion<T> lerp(T fact, const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02889         {
02890                 return Quaternion<T>((1 - fact) * w + fact * rhs.w, v.lerp(fact, rhs.v));
02891         }
02892 
02896         friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& oss, const Quaternion<T>& q)
02897         {
02898                 oss << "Re: " << q.w << " Im: " << q.v;
02899                 return oss;
02900         }
02901 
02908         static Quaternion<T> fromMatrix(const Matrix4<T>& m)
02909         {
02910                 Quaternion<T> q;
02911 
02912                 T tr, s;
02913                 tr = m.at(0, 0) + m.at(1, 1) + m.at(2, 2);
02914                 if (tr >= epsilon)
02915                 {
02916                         s = (T)sqrt(tr + 1);
02917                         q.w = 0.5 * s;
02918                         s = 0.5 / s;
02919 
02920                         q.v.x = (m.at(1, 2) - m.at(2, 1)) * s;
02921                         q.v.y = (m.at(2, 0) - m.at(0, 2)) * s;
02922                         q.v.z = (m.at(0, 1) - m.at(1, 0)) * s;
02923                 }
02924                 else
02925                 {
02926                         T d0 = m.at(0, 0);
02927                         T d1 = m.at(1, 1);
02928                         T d2 = m.at(2, 2);
02929 
02930                         char bigIdx = (d0 > d1) ? ((d0 > d2) ? 0 : 2) : ((d1 > d2) ? 1 : 2);
02931 
02932                         if (bigIdx == 0)
02933                         {
02934                                 s = (T)sqrt((d0 - (d1 + d2)) + 1);
02935 
02936                                 q.v.x = 0.5 * s;
02937                                 s = 0.5 / s;
02938                                 q.v.y = (m.at(1, 0) + m.at(0, 1)) * s;
02939                                 q.v.z = (m.at(2, 0) + m.at(0, 2)) * s;
02940                                 q.w = (m.at(1, 2) - m.at(2, 1)) * s;
02941                         }
02942                         else if (bigIdx == 1)
02943                         {
02944                                 s = (T)sqrt(1 + d1 - (d0 + d2));
02945                                 q.v.y = 0.5 * s;
02946                                 s = 0.5 / s;
02947                                 q.v.z = (m.at(2, 1) + m.at(1, 2)) / s;
02948                                 q.w = (m.at(2, 0) - m.at(0, 2)) / s;
02949                                 q.v.x = (m.at(1, 0) + m.at(0, 1)) / s;
02950                         }
02951                         else
02952                         {
02953                                 s = (T)sqrt(1 + d2 - (d0 + d1));
02954                                 q.v.z = 0.5 * s;
02955                                 s = 0.5 / s;
02956                                 q.w = (m.at(0, 1) - m.at(1, 0)) / s;
02957                                 q.v.x = (m.at(2, 0) + m.at(0, 2)) / s;
02958                                 q.v.y = (m.at(2, 1) + m.at(1, 2)) / s;
02959                         }
02960                 }
02961 
02962                 return q;
02963         }
02964 
02971         static Quaternion<T> fromMatrix(const Matrix3<T>& m)
02972         {
02973                 Quaternion<T> q;
02974 
02975                 T tr, s;
02976                 tr = m.at(0, 0) + m.at(1, 1) + m.at(2, 2);
02977                 // if trace is greater or equal then zero
02978                 if (tr >= epsilon)
02979                 {
02980                         s = (T)sqrt(tr + 1);
02981                         q.w = 0.5 * s;
02982                         s = 0.5 / s;
02983 
02984                         q.v.x = (m.at(1, 2) - m.at(2, 1)) * s;
02985                         q.v.y = (m.at(2, 0) - m.at(0, 2)) * s;
02986                         q.v.z = (m.at(0, 1) - m.at(1, 0)) * s;
02987                 }
02988                 else
02989                 {
02990                         T d0 = m.at(0, 0);
02991                         T d1 = m.at(1, 1);
02992                         T d2 = m.at(2, 2);
02993 
02994                         // find greates diagonal number
02995                         char bigIdx = (d0 > d1) ? ((d0 > d2) ? 0 : 2) : ((d1 > d2) ? 1 : 2);
02996 
02997                         if (bigIdx == 0)
02998                         {
02999                                 s = (T)sqrt((d0 - (d1 + d2)) + 1);
03000 
03001                                 q.v.x = 0.5 * s;
03002                                 s = 0.5 / s;
03003                                 q.v.y = (m.at(1, 0) + m.at(0, 1)) * s;
03004                                 q.v.z = (m.at(2, 0) + m.at(0, 2)) * s;
03005                                 q.w = (m.at(1, 2) - m.at(2, 1)) * s;
03006                         }
03007                         else if (bigIdx == 1)
03008                         {
03009                                 s = (T)sqrt(1 + d1 - (d0 + d2));
03010                                 q.v.y = 0.5 * s;
03011                                 s = 0.5 / s;
03012                                 q.v.z = (m.at(2, 1) + m.at(1, 2)) / s;
03013                                 q.w = (m.at(2, 0) - m.at(0, 2)) / s;
03014                                 q.v.x = (m.at(1, 0) + m.at(0, 1)) / s;
03015                         }
03016                         else
03017                         {
03018                                 s = (T)sqrt(1 + d2 - (d0 + d1));
03019                                 q.v.z = 0.5 * s;
03020                                 s = 0.5 / s;
03021                                 q.w = (m.at(0, 1) - m.at(1, 0)) / s;
03022                                 q.v.x = (m.at(2, 0) + m.at(0, 2)) / s;
03023                                 q.v.y = (m.at(2, 1) + m.at(1, 2)) / s;
03024                         }
03025                 }
03026 
03027                 return q;
03028         }
03029 
03038         Quaternion<T> slerp(T r, const Quaternion<T>& q2) const
03039         {
03040                 Quaternion<T> ret;
03041                 T cosTheta = w * q2.w + v.x * q2.v.x + v.y * q2.v.y + v.z * q2.v.z;
03042                 T theta = (T) acos(cosTheta);
03043                 if (fabs(theta) < epsilon)
03044                 {
03045                         ret = *this;
03046                 }
03047                 else
03048                 {
03049                         T sinTheta = (T)sqrt(1.0 - cosTheta * cosTheta);
03050                         if (fabs(sinTheta) < epsilon)
03051                         {
03052                                 ret.w = 0.5 * w + 0.5 * q2.w;
03053                                 ret.v = v.lerp(0.5, q2.v);
03054                         }
03055                         else
03056                         {
03057                                 T rA = (T)sin((1.0 - r) * theta) / sinTheta;
03058                                 T rB = (T)sin(r * theta) / sinTheta;
03059 
03060                                 ret.w = w * rA + q2.w * rB;
03061                                 ret.v.x = v.x * rA + q2.v.x * rB;
03062                                 ret.v.y = v.y * rA + q2.v.y * rB;
03063                                 ret.v.z = v.z * rA + q2.v.z * rB;
03064                         }
03065                 }
03066                 return ret;
03067         }
03068 
03069 
03070 
03071 };
03072 
03073 typedef Quaternion<float> Quatf;
03074 typedef Quaternion<double> Quatd;
03075

03079 }
